body:
The "fix" for this will mostly entail moving (parts) of this defer 
https://github.com/grafana/k6/blob/ab810e79c9f2428be82b641d1b02d0d843c49c54/js/modules/k6/ws/ws.go#L324-L337
 up, before this line
https://github.com/grafana/k6/blob/ab810e79c9f2428be82b641d1b02d0d843c49c54/js/modules/k6/ws/ws.go#L300-L301

This might turn out to require more changes though due to some more shared state.

repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

body:
>it seems reasonable to also emit `ws_session_duration`

I agree

>up, before this line

@mstoykov Why do we emit `WSSessions` a few lines before? Should we move it to the same place where we set the defer? I would expect to always emit `ws_session_duration` if we are emitting `ws_sessions`.

This was *changed* as part of https://github.com/grafana/k6/pull/1367. Before it everything was done when the websocket ends. This had a couple of different problems, the biggest one being that long running websocket connections with a lot of ws_message_received, used to take quite a while to push all the metrics when this ended. It was also very strange that we were emitting metrics a few minutes after they happened. And caching all of that was taking a lot of memory. All in all, it was a bad and this PR fixed that.

Looking at the description I meant to leave the emittion of the sesions and connectio nmetrics at the end but @na-- [asked](https://github.com/grafana/k6/pull/1367#discussion_r395081802) to be moved as much "up" as possible. 

From purely logical point of view - we do have a session from the moment the connection happens. The "open" callback is called after that and might take as much time as it wants to complete.

So it makes a lot of senses to also send `ws_session_duration` even if the "open" callback aborts.

issue.title: Fix emission of `ws_session_duration` when setup throws an error

Closes #2734

This only fixes the issue, but see #2768 for some related refactoring of `WS.Connect()`.

issue.title: Refactor `WS.Connect()`

repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
This refactors parts of the `WS.Connect()` method to extract argument parsing and establishing of the WS connection into separate functions.

It's built on top of #2767, so we should review/merge that first.
